noun.definition: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
noun.example: Police are appealing for witnesses to the accident.
The empty room was a silent witness to the tragedy.

verb.definition: See (an event, typically a crime or accident) take place.
Give or serve as evidence of; testify to.
verb.example: His will was witnessed by two lawyers.

usage_examples: She was a key witness for the prosecution.
I witnessed the whole thing from my window.
